books.title: So Big
books.author: Edna Ferber
books.summary: A woman discovers her own inner strength when she decides to teach children in a rural farming area.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Pollyanna
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: An orphan’s unrelenting optimism sees her through adversity and lifts up her new community.

books.title: Kipps
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: An orphan raised by his aunt and uncle struggles as a young man to integrate into upper class society after receiving a substantial inheritance from his grandfather.

books.title: The Hairy Ape
books.author: Eugene O’Neill
books.summary: An expressionist play following a brutish stoker’s dehumanization as he descends from being a leader of his fellow workers to a literal ape.

books.title: Five Children and It
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children encounter an ancient magical creature who grants them wishes—all of which go comically wrong.

books.title: The Cords of Vanity
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: An arrogant young author makes his way through a series of love affairs, avoiding every situation that may cause unpleasantness.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: The Middle of Things
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: The murder of a wealthy man raises questions about the identity of the young woman who is his ward.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Servile State
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc’s thesis that the capitalist state breeds a collectivist theory which, in action, produces something utterly different from collectivism: the Servile State.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Edward Thomas
books.summary: A collection of poetry by Edward Thomas.

books.title: Sunshine Sketches of a Little Town
books.author: Stephen Leacock
books.summary: A humorous account of life in the fictional small town of Mariposa.

books.title: The Jewels of Aptor
books.author: Samuel R. Delany
books.summary: Four companions travel to the mysterious island of Aptor in search of a jewel.

books.title: Golf Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s golf stories featuring the Oldest Member.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
